title: Progress reporting on "filesystem without fifo support" - floods INFO msgs
body:
I was investigating #4774 and got surprised with the logging output I never saw before:
```
$> DATALAD_TESTS_TEMP_FS=exfat ./eval_under_testloopfs bash
I: exfat of 10:  /home/yoh/.tmp/datalad-fs-KL8Fq
10+0 records in
10+0 records out
10321920 bytes (10 MB, 9.8 MiB) copied, 0.00988488 s, 1.0 GB/s
[sudo] password for yoh: 
mkexfatfs 1.3.0
Creating... done.
Flushing... done.
File system created successfully.
FUSE exfat 1.3.0
I: running bash
I: New layout of history files also found.
   Please remove/propagate old history into new
(git)/home/yoh/proj/datalad/datalad-maint:tools[debian]
#1 !1469 [0].....................................:Thu Aug 13 23:15:40:.
lena:~/proj/datalad/datalad-maint/tools
$> cd /home/yoh/.tmp/datalad-fs-KL8Fq
total 0

#2 !1470 [0].....................................:Thu Aug 13 23:15:54:.
lena:~/.tmp/datalad-fs-KL8Fq
$> datalad install ///openneuro/ds000001
[INFO   ] Detected a filesystem without fifo support.                                                            
|   Disabling ssh connection caching.                                                                            
[INFO   ] Detected a crippled filesystem. 
[INFO   ] Scanning for unlocked files (this may take some time) 
[INFO   ] Entering an adjusted branch where files are unlocked as this filesystem does not support locked files. 
[INFO   ] Updating files:  26% (21/80) 
[INFO   ] Updating files:  27% (22/80) 
[INFO   ] Updating files:  28% (23/80) 
[INFO   ] Updating files:  30% (24/80)

| 		datalad siblings -d "/home/yoh/.tmp/datalad-fs-KL8Fq/ds000001" enable -s s3-PRIVATE 
install(ok): /home/yoh/.tmp/datalad-fs-KL8Fq/ds000001 (dataset)

#3 !1471 [0].....................................:Thu Aug 13 23:16:27:.
lena:~/.tmp/datalad-fs-KL8Fq
$> datalad --version
datalad 0.13.2.dev309
```

It is not too bad in this case of 80 bannanas (or may be files? or what?), but I guess it could be worse and ideally we should avoid flooding the screen with those if possible
